introParagraph.text: Before you leave for the University, make sure you have these essential tasks done!

FAQItems.question: Which visa do I apply for?
FAQItems.answer:
As an international student, you need to hold a valid Australian visa for the duration of your study in Sydney. There are several different types of visa that might be suitable. Refer to the Australian Government Department of Home Affairs for titlermation.

If you are applying for a student visa, you can apply as soon as you receive your electronic confirmation of enrolment (eCoE) from the University.

If you are already in Australia and need to extend your visa, you can apply for an extension eCoE through Sydney Student.

FAQItems.question: I need short-term accommodation before my course starts.
FAQItems.answer: If you require short term accommodation before your course starts, Accommodation Services has compiled a list to help with that.

introParagraph.text: When you arrive in Sydney, there are certain things you must do to properly prepare and set up for your time here.

FAQItems.question: I want to get involved in student life.
FAQItems.answer: The university has wide and varied experiences for students. Student life is largely dominated by activities hosted by student organisations and clubs and societies. We encourage you to get involved and get the most out of your University experience.

FAQItems.question: Where can I get help for international student- specific concerns ?
FAQItems.answer: For general concerns about your enrolment and life at the University, the Student Centre is the best place to direct your enquiry. If you have more international student-specific concerns, our team of compliance officers is here to help you with basic issues related to student visas and your studies in general.

introParagraph.text: This is a list of resources for you while you are studying and living in Australia.

FAQItems.question: How do I get around Sydney?
FAQItems.answer: The easiest and most common means of transport around Sydney is the public transport system. You will need an Opal card to access the system (which includes buses, trains, light rails, and ferries around the Greater Sydney area).

FAQItems.question: What are some resources for my health and wellbeing?
FAQItems.answer: Here you can find a range of titlermation and resources to help you keep yourself healthy while at university. From common mental health issues and support contacts, to mindfulness and general health tips, these pages are designed to help you support yourself and others.
